t: Matthew 22
The Parable of the Wedding Feast
And*p Jesus answered and spoke to them again by parables and said:
“The*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r a*r certain*r king*r who*r arranged*r a*r marriage*r for*r his*r son,*r
and*r sent*r out*r his*r servants*r to*r call*r those*r who*r were*r invited*r to*r the*r wedding;*r and*r they*r were*r not*r willing*r to*r come.*r

Again,*r he*r sent*r out*r other*r servants,*r saying,*r ‘Tell*r those*r who*r are*r invited,*r “See,*r I*r have*r prepared*r my*r dinner;*r my*r oxen*r and*r fatted*r cattle*r are*ir killed,*r and*r all*r things*r are*ir ready.*r Come*r to*r the*r wedding.”’*r
But*r they*r made*r light*r of*r it*r and*r went*r their*r ways,*r one*r to*r his*r own*r farm,*r another*r to*r his*r business.*r
And*r the*r rest*r seized*r his*r servants,*r treated*r them*ir spitefully,*r and*r killed*r them.*ir
But*r when*r the*r king*r heard*r about*ir it,*ir he*r was*r furious.*r And*r he*r sent*r out*r his*r armies,*r destroyed*r those*r murderers,*r and*r burned*r up*r their*r city.*r
Then*r he*r said*r to*r his*r servants,*r ‘The*r wedding*r is*r ready,*r but*r those*r who*r were*r invited*r were*r not*r worthy.*r
Therefore*r go*r into*r the*r highways,*r and*r as*r many*r as*r you*r find,*r invite*r to*r the*r wedding.’*r

So*r those*r servants*r went*r out*r into*r the*r highways*r and*r gathered*r together*r all*r whom*r they*r found,*r both*r bad*r and*r good.*r And*r the*r wedding*r hall*ir was*r filled*r with*r guests.*r
“But*rp when*r the*r king*r came*r in*r to*r see*r the*r guests,*r he*r saw*r a*r man*r there*r who*r did*r not*r have*r on*r a*r wedding*r garment.*r
So*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Friend,*r how*r did*r you*r come*r in*r here*r without*r a*r wedding*r garment?’*r And*r he*r was*r speechless.*r

Then*r the*r king*r said*r to*r the*r servants,*r ‘Bind*r him*r hand*r and*r foot,*r take*r him*r away,*r and*r cast*r him*ir into*r outer*r darkness;*r there*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.’*r
“For*rp many*r are*r called,*r but*r few*r are*ir chosen.”*r
The Pharisees: Is It Lawful to Pay Taxes to Caesar?
Then*p the Pharisees went and plotted how they might entangle Him in His*i talk.

And they sent to Him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that You are true, and teach the way of God in truth; nor do You care about anyone, for You do not regard the person of men.
Tell us, therefore, what do You think? Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
But*p Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, “Why*r do*r you*r test*r Me,*r you*ir hypocrites?*r
Show*r Me*r the*r tax*r money.”*r So*p they brought Him a denarius.
And*p He said to them, “Whose*r image*r and*r inscription*r is*ir this?”*r
They*p said to Him, “Caesar’s.” And*p He said to them, “Render*r therefore*r to*r Caesar*r the*r things*r that*r are*r Caesar’s,*r and*r to*r God*r the*r things*r that*r are*r God’s.”*r
When they had heard these*i words,*i they marveled, and left Him and went their way.
The Sadducees: What About the Resurrection?
The*p same day the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Him and asked Him,
saying: “Teacher, Moses said that if a man dies, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.
Now there were with us seven brothers. The first died after he had married, and having no offspring, left his wife to his brother.
Likewise the second also, and the third, even to the seventh.
Last of all the woman died also.
Therefore, in the resurrection, whose wife of the seven will she be? For they all had her.”
Jesus*p answered and said to them, “You*r are*r mistaken,*r not*r knowing*r the*r Scriptures*r nor*r the*r power*r of*r God.*r
For*r in*r the*r resurrection*r they*r neither*r marry*r nor*r are*r given*r in*r marriage,*r but*r are*r like*r angels*r of*r God*r in*r heaven.*r
But*r concerning*r the*r resurrection*r of*r the*r dead,*r have*r you*r not*r read*r what*r was*r spoken*r to*r you*r by*r God,*r saying,*r
‘I*r am*r the*r God*r of*r Abraham,*r the*r God*r of*r Isaac,*r and*r the*r God*r of*r Jacob’?*r God*r is*r not*r the*r God*r of*r the*r dead,*r but*r of*r the*r living.”*r
And when the multitudes heard this,*i they were astonished at His teaching.
The Scribes: Which Is the First Commandment of All?
But*p when the Pharisees heard that He had silenced the Sadducees, they gathered together.
Then one of them, a lawyer, asked Him*i a*i question,*i testing Him, and saying,
“Teacher, which is*i the great commandment in the law?”
Jesus*p said to him, “‘You*r shall*r love*r the*r Lord*sbr your*r God*r with*r all*r your*r heart,*r with*r all*r your*r soul,*r and*r with*r all*r your*r mind.’*r
This*r is*r the*ir first*r and*r great*r commandment.*r
And*r the*ir second*r is*ir like*r it:*r ‘You*r shall*r love*r your*r neighbor*r as*r yourself.’*r
On*r these*r two*r commandments*r hang*r all*r the*r Law*r and*r the*r Prophets.”*r
Jesus: How Can David Call His Descendant Lord?
While*p the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,
saying, “What*r do*r you*r think*r about*r the*r Christ?*r Whose*r Son*r is*r He?”*r They*p said to Him, “The*i Son of David.”
He*p said to them, “How*r then*r does*r David*r in*r the*r Spirit*r call*r Him*r ‘Lord,’*r saying:*r
‘The*rpn Lord*sr said*r to*r my*r Lord,*r “Sit*rld at*r My*r right*r hand,*r Till*rld I*r make*r Your*r enemies*r Your*r footstool”’?*r
If*rp David*r then*r calls*r Him*r ‘Lord,’*r how*r is*r He*r his*r Son?”*r
And no one was able to answer Him a word, nor from that day on did anyone dare question Him anymore.
